content:
- intentId: ADR75782
  intentName: RequestSoftwareInstallation
  description: >
    A formal or informal communication from an individual or department within an organization
    to the IT support team. In this request, the sender is asking for assistance in installing a
    specific piece of software on their computer or a designated system.
 
    slots:
      - slotID: SofWN12
        slotName: SoftwareName
        description: Indicates specific software's actual name
        type: String
      - slotID: Ver341
        slotName: Version
        description: Refers to a specific release or iteration of a software program.
        type: String
      - slotID: Vend2738
        slotName: Vendor
        description: The company or entity that develops, sells, or distributes the software,
                     provides customer support, and releases updates or new versions.
        type: String
  example: I am writing to request assistance with the installation of Adobe Photoshop, Version 22.0.1 on my workstation.

- intentId: BT6371
  intentName: EmailAccessIssue
  description: >
    Email Access Issue refers to a problem or difficulty an individual is experiencing
    when trying to access their email account.
    slots:
      - slotID: EAppl2374
        slotName: emailApplication
        description: A software program or application that enables users to send, receive, and manage emails
        type: String
        possibleValues: [Microsoft Outlook]
      - slotID: BR54681
        slotName: browser
        description: A software application used to access and view information on the World Wide Web
        type: String
        possibleValues: [Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox]
  example: >
    I’m currently experiencing difficulties accessing my corporate email account (username
    john.doe@bestcompany.org) on my desktop email client (Microsoft Outlook). When attempting
    to log in, I receive an error message, and despite multiple attempts, I am unable to gain access.

- intentId: RSA0342
  intentName: RSATokenRequest
  description: >
    Any request for a temporary token / one-time password to set up VPN or get access to
    company-internal servers and apps for use in two-factor authentication (2FA) systems.
  slots:
    - slotID: SeN2627
      slotName: SerialNumber
      description: A unique identifier for the RSA token, usually printed on the physical token or provided when the token is issued.
      type: integer
    - slotID: TC3681
      slotName: TokenCode
      description: The current six-digit numeric code generated by the RSA token. The code changes at regular intervals,
                   providing a dynamic and time-sensitive element to the authentication process.
      type: integer
    - slotID: TC3681
      slotName: Expiration
      description: Indicates the date when the RSA token is set to expire. After this date, the token may need to be renewed or replaced.
      type: String
  example: I am writing to request the activation of an RSA token for enhanced security measures in accessing our corporate systems.
  
- intentId: HWReq091
  intentName: HardwareRequest
  description: >
    Requests for a new piece of hardware (physical devices). To be used only if there is an explicit
    request for hardware present, not if a user just says a piece of hardware doesn't work.
  slots:
    - slotID: hw0947
      slotName: HardWareType
      description: Refers to the physical components of a computer system or electronic device.
                   These tangible parts can be seen and touched, and they work together to enable the device to function.
      type: String
      possibleValues: [mouse, cable, laptop, phone, motherboard, USB, keyboards, monitor, printer, scanner, headphones]
    - slotID: hwNa6492
      slotName: HardWareBrand
      description: Refers to the company or manufacturer that produces physical components or devices,
                   often related to technology and electronics.
      type: String
    - slotID: hwMo50
      slotName: HardWareBrand
      description: A specific version or configuration of a physical device or component produced by a manufacturer.
                   It is a unique identifier that distinguishes one variant of hardware from another within a product line.
      type: String
  example: >
    I am requesting a new keyboard for my workstation (Employee ID: NT56279100).
    The current keyboard Logitech MK545 has become unreliable, with several keys intermittently
    malfunctioning, impacting my productivity.

INSTRUCTION :
You are a system that performs the following tasks.  First, you should read the above text  to understand how each intent is defined by reading the descriptions associated with each intent and understanding the constraints required for each intent.  Each intent also has an example provided that specifies a viable utterance that would be classified into that given intent class.  Each intent will also have a unique ID associated with it. 
 
For each intent there are also slots associated with them.  Slots are values that need to be retrieved for a particular intent.  Each slot will have a name, datatype, and description.  It may also include a field possibleValues which means the slot must match one of the provided values.  It could also include a field exampleValues where examples are given but the extracted slots do not need to exactly match those given values.  If multiple slots are provided, fill all the slots.  If a slot is not provided, set the value of the slot to N/A. 
 
Below is an utterance.  You should read the entirety of the utterance and determine which intent would best match the user’s request.  If there are multiple intents, that would match the utterance equally well, make sure to output both.  For each chosen intent, extract the slots if present and set the slot value to N/A if it is not present. 
 
Give your final output as a JSON.  The JSON should always have a key “output”.  The value of “output” should be a dictionary where the key of this dictionary is the intent id and the values is a subdictionary where the keys are the slot ids associated with the given intent and the values are the slot values.  All possible slots keys should be present in the JSON for a given intent even if the slot value does not exist in the utterance.  If the output is not within this format, you will be heavily penalized. 

UTTERANCE :

I am currently experiencing issues with accessing my email account due to expired credentials, (username martha.doe@company.com on my desktop email client (Microsoft Outlook). I usually work on Mozilla Firefox.
Additionally, my current headphones JBL Live 650TNC have ceased to function, and I I kindly request a replacement with a similar or suitable model available in our inventory to maintain effective communication and participation in virtual meetings.
